gw.api.metric

Class FilteredArray<T extends KeyableBean>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.metric.FilteredArray<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<T>

    public class FilteredArray<T extends KeyableBean>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<T>
    Utility class to efficiently fetch just the members of an array that match a series of filters. Uses queries where possible, but takes the current contents of the bundle into account. Can also return the array size and the first member of an array as sorted by a particular property of the array member

    • Constructor Summary

        public FilteredArray<T> where(IEntityPropertyInfo property,
                              Relop op,

        Add a filter to the array; only items where the given property matches the given value, according to the specified operation will pass the filter
        Parameters:
        property - the property to check
        op - the operation (=, !=, <, etc.)
        value - the value to compare the property against

      • and

        public FilteredArray<T> and(IEntityPropertyInfo property,
                            Relop op,
                            java.lang.Object value)
        Add a filter to the array; only items where the given property matches the given value, according to the specified operation will pass the filter. This method is a synonym for where, it usually reads better to use where first followed by some number of ands.
        Parameters:
        property - the property to check
        op - the operation (=, !=, <, etc.)
        value - the value to compare the property against
        Returns:
        the modified FilteredArray

      • orderedByAscending

        public FilteredArray<T> orderedByAscending(IEntityPropertyInfo property)
        Add an ordering to the array, which will cause the array contents to be sorted in ascending order of the given property. If other orderings have already been added this new ordering will only come into play if the array member is equal according to all the previous orderings
        Parameters:
        property - the property to order by
        Returns:
        the modified FilteredArray

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the modified FilteredArray

      • getContents

        public java.util.List<T> getContents()
        Return the contents of the array, with the specified filters and orderings applied
        Returns:
        the array contents, possibly empty, never null

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<T> iterator()
        Creates an iterator that can be used to iterate over the contents of the filtered array. In the case where the creator of this FilteredArray may not be expecting to use all its contents this can often be a more efficient approach to iteration than iterating through the List returned by getContents() as it chunks the results from the database as needed rather than materializing them all from the start.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<T extends KeyableBean>
        Returns:
        an Iterator over the contents of the filtered array, possibly empty, never null

      • first

        public T first()
        Return the first element of the array, with the specified filters and orderings applied. If no orderings were specified the value of the first element is unpredictable - it could be any of the values in the array.
        Returns:
        the first element, or null if the filtered array is empty

      • getCount

        public int getCount()
        Return the number of elements in the array, with the specified filters and orderings applied
        Returns:
        the count of array elements
